str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of arguros; silvery, i.e. cash; specially, a silverling.
And, even, also, namely.
A piece of gold, golden ornament. Diminutive of chrusos; a golden article, i.e. Gold plating, ornament, or coin.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A Nazarene, an inhabitant of Nazareth. From Nazareth; a Nazoraean, i.e. Inhabitant of Nazareth; by extension, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
